channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Tim Walz rides Taylor Swift's support to fire back at JD Vance: 'You mess with cat people ...'
item.description: Tim Walz, Vice President Kamala Harris' running mate, took a jab at JD Vance for his 'childless cat ladies' remarks. Pop star Taylor Swift endorsed Harris and Walz on Instagram. Walz thanked Swift for her support and highlighted the influence of cat owners in politics. Vance had previously criticized Democrats for being led by childless individuals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Prince Harry called off his birthday bash at last minute 'due to Kate Middleton'
item.description: Prince Harry will mark his 40th birthday on Sunday with family and later a getaway with friends. Ten years ago, he postponed his 30th birthday party because of Kate Middleton's severe morning sickness. This year, he plans an international trip with close friends such as Nacho Figueras.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump extends pet-theft claims: After cats and dogs, Haitian immigrants allegedly stealing geese too
item.description: Donald Trump has amplified his baseless claims about Haitian immigrants, now accusing them of stealing geese in Springfield, Ohio. The actual disturbance was a bomb threat at City Hall. Local leaders commend Haitian immigrants for their hard work. Trump also criticized Vice President Kamala Harris and spoke about changing voter demographics during his rally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Debate fallout: Trump accuses ABC News of bias as Harris campaign pushes for rematch; Mark Penn calls for investigation
item.description: A contentious debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris has sparked allegations of bias from Trump's camp against ABC News. Critics claim Harris received questions in advance, prompting calls for an internal investigation. Connections between Harris and ABC News personnel have further fueled the controversy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ecuador prison chief killed, second this month: Officials
item.description: Maria Daniela Icaza, director of Ecuador's largest prison, was fatally attacked near Guayaquil. This marks the second killing of a prison director within two weeks. Ecuador's prisons are notorious for gang control and violence. The country has experienced a sharp increase in homicides due to transnational cartels using its ports for drug trafficking.

item.title: White House rebukes Trump over ties to far-right figure Laura Loomer: 'No leader should associate with racist poison'
item.description: The White House condemned former President Donald Trump for associating with far-right conspiracy theorist Laura Loomer. Known for her incendiary posts, Loomer has been seen accompanying Trump at various events. The White House criticized Loomer's racist comments about Vice President Kamala Harris and called Trump's association with her 'repugnant' and 'un-American.'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Annapurna Interactive's entire staff resigns, leaving developers scrambling: Report
item.description: Annapurna Interactive's entire team resigned after failing to reach an agreement on spinning off as an independent entity. Despite this, the company assures support for ongoing projects and aims to expand in the interactive space. Newly appointed president Hector Sanchez promises to fulfill contractual obligations and fill vacant positions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Trump declines another presidential debate with Harris, VP says ‘We owe it to the voters’
item.description: Donald Trump announced he will not participate in another debate with Kamala Harris, focusing on battleground states before the US presidential election. Despite Harris' request for a second debate, Trump declared himself the winner of their recent face-off. Polls suggest Harris performed better, reflecting her growing momentum.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Los Angeles hit by dozens of aftershocks from 4.7 Malibu earthquake
item.description: A 4.7 magnitude earthquake shook the Los Angeles area with its epicenter near Malibu, followed by more than two dozen aftershocks. The region is simultaneously dealing with three major wildfires east of Los Angeles. Despite intense shaking felt by residents, no significant damage was reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: White House calls out Trump for 'filthy' lies about haitian migrants eating pets: 'Lives are in danger'
item.description: The White House has sharply criticized former President Donald Trump for spreading false stories about Haitian migrants in Ohio eating pet cats and dogs. Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre denounced the claims as dangerous misinformation that endangers migrant communities. These narratives have been debunked by local authorities, raising concerns about their impact on public perception and safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Kamala Harris widens lead over Donald Trump after presidential debate showdown, polls show
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has surged ahead of former President Donald Trump after their Philadelphia debate, leading 47% to 42% in a Reuters/Ipsos poll. The debate was marked by sharp exchanges, with Harris pressing Trump on his fitness for office and legal issues. A CNN flash poll showed 60% of viewers believed Harris dominated the stage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan stand-off over cops seeking army exit from restive province drags on
item.description: In northwestern Pakistan, police units are striking to demand the withdrawal of military and intelligence agencies from their region. They accuse these forces of interfering in their duties and worsening security conditions. The protest has led to blocked highways and increased tensions, with no signs of resolution so far.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Donald Trump says there will be no third debate, Kamala wants one because...
item.description: Donald Trump stated he will not engage in another debate with Kamala Harris, referencing a poll indicating his victory. He criticized ABC moderators for perceived bias. While Harris's campaign seeks another debate in October, Trump's team maintains they have already agreed to three debates, questioning the need for more. Donald Trump debated with President Joe Biden on CNN which was the first debate of this presidential election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump likes Laura Loomer, she might be behind 'Kamala Harris Indian or Black' attack: Report
item.description: ​According to a CNN report, several people close to Trump said Loomer has contributed to some of the "unseemly conspiracy theories Trump has elevates since Harris replaced Biden on the ticket". It was Laura who accused Kamala Harris of hiding her Black heritage and that eventually landed up with Donald Trump. "Others pushed back on the notion she was behind Trump's remarks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bush's attorney general says 'I can't sit quietly', endorses Kamala Harris
item.description: Gonzales said he spoke with Trump only once and does not really know him. "It is telling, however, that several senior officials who worked for him in the White House now refuse to support him, including his vice president, chief of staff, defense secretary and national security adviser. Their unwillingness to endorse their former boss is an indictment of his character at a level equal to his many, many criminal indictments," he wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In the (y)ear of conspiracy theories, Trump hears insults galore
item.description: Kamala Harris decisively outperformed Donald Trump in the presidential debate, sparking baseless conspiracy theories among MAGA supporters. Despite Trump's insistence on winning, consensus points to his defeat. Celebrity endorsements for Harris and criticism from notable figures have weakened Trump's campaign, with even some Republicans questioning his capability to be in office.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Bomb threat at Springfield after Republicans spread conspiracy theory about Haitian immigrants
item.description: Several establishments at Ohio's Springfield including the Springfield City Hall Thursday received bomb threat. Police confirmed the threats and said that some buildings were being evacuated due to an unspecified threat. The threat came as Republicans push conspiracy theories that Haitian immigrants who have settled at Springfield are stealing the pets of other residents and eating cats and ducks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump shares Barron's childhood photo in latest promotion for her memoir
item.description: In a new promotional video for her memoir, Melania Trump shared unseen childhood photos of Barron Trump and discussed the challenges and rewards of motherhood. Barron Trump is very popular mostly because of his height of 6 feet 8 inches that makes him stand out wherever he goes. Though his childhood remained under the shrouds of secrecy, Barron is more visible now and debuted at his father's rally this election campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's debate performance was not his worst but...: GOP pollster Frank Luntz
item.description: While Donald Trump insists that he on the debate against Kamala Harris though polls show otherwise, Trump ally RFK Jr told Fox News that Harris has clearly won the debate. “Vice President Harris clearly won the debate in terms of her delivery, polish, organization, and preparation,” RFK Jr said without any pretence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Friendly nations helped Pakistan meet IMF bailout conditions, says PM Shehbaz Sharif
item.description: Pakistan is set to receive a $7 billion IMF bailout package after fulfilling required conditions with help from friendly nations. The loan aims to alleviate economic distress through stringent reforms and increased revenue. With external debt exceeding $130 billion, financial experts express concerns about the inflationary impact of Pakistan’s debt-driven fiscal deficit management.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
